name: Zilker Park
description: Austin's beloved 350-acre metropolitan park with Barton Springs, botanical gardens, and endless recreation.
longDescription: Zilker Park is the crown jewel of Austin's park system—a 350-acre oasis in the heart of the city that serves as Austin's backyard. The park encompasses Barton Springs Pool, the Zilker Botanical Garden, the Austin Nature & Science Center, and vast open fields perfect for kite flying, frisbee, and festivals. The park borders Lady Bird Lake and connects to the Ann and Roy Butler Hike-and-Bike Trail. It's the host venue for Austin City Limits Music Festival, the Trail of Lights, and countless community events. For Austin homebuyers, proximity to Zilker is a premium feature.
tips: Free parking but fills up fast

name: Barton Springs Pool
description: Iconic spring-fed swimming pool maintaining a constant 68-70 degrees year-round in the heart of Zilker Park.
longDescription: Barton Springs Pool is Austin's most sacred natural feature—a spring-fed swimming pool that maintains a constant 68-70 degrees year-round, fed by underground springs from the Edwards Aquifer. The three-acre pool, set within Zilker Park, has been a gathering place for thousands of years. On a 100-degree Austin summer day, plunging into the cool, clear water is a transcendent experience. Regulars swim year-round, including through winter when steam rises from the water. The pool is surrounded by a grassy hillside perfect for sunbathing, and the atmosphere is pure Austin—diverse, casual, and deeply connected to nature.
tips: Free entry before 8 AM and after 9 PM

name: Mount Bonnell
description: Austin's highest point with stunning panoramic views of Lake Austin, the Hill Country, and the city skyline.
longDescription: Mount Bonnell is one of Austin's oldest tourist attractions, offering panoramic views from the city's highest point at 775 feet. A short but steep climb of 102 stone steps rewards visitors with breathtaking vistas of Lake Austin, the surrounding Hill Country, and the Austin skyline in the distance. The overlook is especially popular at sunset, when the limestone cliffs glow golden and the city lights begin to twinkle. It's a traditional spot for proposals, first dates, and contemplating the beauty of the Austin landscape. Despite its popularity, early morning visits offer peaceful solitude.
tips: Go at sunset for best views

name: Congress Avenue Bridge Bat Colony
description: World's largest urban bat colony emerges nightly from under the Congress Avenue Bridge in a spectacular natural display.
longDescription: Every evening from March through November, approximately 1.5 million Mexican free-tailed bats emerge from beneath the Congress Avenue Bridge in one of nature's most spectacular urban wildlife displays. The colony, the largest urban bat colony in the world, streams out at dusk in a dark, undulating ribbon that can take 20-30 minutes to fully emerge. Watching from the bridge, the south shore of Lady Bird Lake, or from kayaks on the water is a quintessential Austin experience. The bats consume tons of insects nightly, making them beloved ecological contributors to the region.
tips: South side of bridge for best view

name: ACL Live at The Moody Theater
description: Home of Austin City Limits TV show tapings with intimate concerts and the best live music experience in Austin.
longDescription: ACL Live at The Moody Theater is the home of the legendary Austin City Limits television show—the longest-running music series in American TV history. The intimate 2,750-seat venue hosts tapings of the show alongside a full calendar of concerts featuring major artists across all genres. The acoustics are pristine, the sightlines are excellent from every seat, and the atmosphere carries the weight of decades of musical history. Attending a taping (free but competitive to get tickets) or a concert here is experiencing Austin's music culture at its finest.
address: 310 W Willie Nelson Blvd, Austin, TX 78701
tips: Apply for free ACL TV tapings
No bad seats in the venue

name: Blanton Museum of Art
description: University of Texas art museum with world-class collection spanning 6,000 years of art history.
longDescription: The Blanton Museum of Art at the University of Texas is one of the largest university art museums in the United States, with a permanent collection of over 21,000 works spanning 6,000 years. The collection is particularly strong in Latin American art, Italian Renaissance, and modern American art. The building itself is architecturally striking, and Ellsworth Kelly's 'Austin'—a stunning stone building with colored glass windows—is a must-see installation. Free on Thursdays, the museum provides world-class art in an accessible, welcoming environment.
address: 200 E Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Austin, TX 78701

name: LBJ Presidential Library
description: Presidential library and museum honoring Lyndon B. Johnson with exhibits on civil rights, the Great Society, and more.
longDescription: The LBJ Presidential Library on the University of Texas campus offers a compelling journey through one of America's most consequential presidencies. The exhibits cover the Civil Rights Act, the Great Society, Vietnam, and the tumultuous 1960s with honesty and depth. A full-scale replica of the Oval Office provides a tangible connection to presidential power. The library's approach is notably candid about both LBJ's achievements and controversies. Free admission makes it accessible to all, and the building's brutalist architecture is impressive in its own right.
tips: Oval Office replica is a highlight

name: Lady Bird Lake
description: Austin's urban reservoir with 10-mile hike-and-bike trail, kayaking, paddleboarding, and stunning skyline views.
longDescription: Lady Bird Lake (formerly Town Lake) is the recreational heart of Austin—a reservoir on the Colorado River that runs through the center of the city. The 10-mile Ann and Roy Butler Hike-and-Bike Trail encircles the lake, providing Austin's most popular running, walking, and cycling path. On the water, kayaking, paddleboarding, and rowing are popular year-round (no motorized boats allowed). The skyline views from the water are stunning, and the trail connects some of Austin's most desirable neighborhoods. For homebuyers, proximity to Lady Bird Lake is one of the most sought-after features in Austin real estate.

name: South Congress Avenue (SoCo)
description: Austin's most iconic street with boutiques, restaurants, food trucks, and live music defining the city's culture.
longDescription: South Congress Avenue—SoCo—is Austin's cultural Main Street and the best introduction to what makes the city special. The stretch between Barton Springs Road and Oltorf is lined with independent boutiques, acclaimed restaurants, food trucks, live music venues, and art galleries. The view of the Texas State Capitol looking north up Congress is one of Austin's most photographed scenes. First Thursday celebrations bring extended hours and a street-festival atmosphere. For homebuyers, the South Congress area represents Austin at its most walkable and culturally vibrant.
tips: Walk both sides of the street
Parking is easier on side streets

name: Texas State Capitol
description: Stunning 1888 granite capitol building taller than the US Capitol, with free tours and beautiful grounds.
longDescription: The Texas State Capitol is one of the most impressive state capitol buildings in America—intentionally built taller than the US Capitol in Washington. The 1888 building, constructed from distinctive sunset red granite, features a magnificent rotunda, legislative chambers, and 22 acres of beautifully maintained grounds. Free guided tours run throughout the day, offering insights into Texas history and government. The south grounds provide a stunning view down Congress Avenue, and the extension features modern legislative spaces connected to the historic building.

name: Sixth Street Entertainment District
description: Austin's legendary entertainment strip with dozens of live music venues, bars, and nightlife options.
longDescription: Sixth Street is where Austin's 'Live Music Capital of the World' reputation comes alive. The stretch between Congress Avenue and I-35 becomes a pedestrian-only zone on weekend nights, with live music pouring out of dozens of venues. From intimate listening rooms to raucous dance halls, the concentration of live music here is unmatched in America. East 6th (east of I-35) has evolved into a more craft-cocktail, foodie-oriented strip, while Dirty Sixth (the original) maintains its party energy. Red River Street, just north, offers Austin's best rock and indie venues.
highlights: Live Music Capital of the World
tips: Free live music in most venues

name: Bullock Texas State History Museum
description: Three floors of immersive Texas history exhibits plus an IMAX theater, telling the story of the Lone Star State.
longDescription: The Bullock Texas State History Museum takes visitors through the epic story of Texas across three floors of exhibits, from its earliest inhabitants through statehood and into the modern era. Interactive displays, artifacts, and multimedia installations make the history vivid and engaging. The museum also houses an IMAX theater and a 4D theater for special presentations. The building's distinctive exterior, featuring a massive copper star, makes it an Austin landmark. It's the best place to understand Texas identity and history.
tips: Free first Sunday of the month
